attributes.action: At rush hours, to reduce congestion, ban the use of Lorries, vans and other commercial vehicles except for essential service vehicles on Britain’s roads.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Tony wants us to give him alternatives to charging, well here is one. If we limit the number of vehicles on the road at rush hour we increase the overall speed of the journey which in turn reduces congestion. By preventing commercial vehicles (Lorries, vans etc) from using the roads between 7-9am and 5-7pm we should drastically reduce congestion.
The exception to this rule must be road recovery services, buses and other essential vehicles.
Businesses should be able to work around this restriction with minimal cost overheads.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
